alert.note: Alert for Russell (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 9:39PM CST until February 04 at 6:45AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Lee and Russell. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 939 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Auburn, Phenix City, Opelika, Smiths, Smiths Station, Griffen Mill, Bleecker, Beauregard, Ladonia, Uchee, Parkmanville, Marvyn, Monterey Heights, Ladonia Sports Complex, Phenix Drag Strip and Chewacla State Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
